summary: This bill, the Prohibition of Agricultural Land for Foreign Adversaries Act, aims to prevent individuals and entities connected to specific foreign governments (North Korea, Iran, China, and Russia) from purchasing agricultural land in the United States. It grants the President authority to enforce this prohibition using the International Emergency Economic Powers Act and also prohibits these 'covered persons' from participating in most Department of Agriculture programs, with exceptions for food safety regulations. Penalties for violations are specified under the same law.
